snippet: Effective monopolies are the rule in technology companies. But with a recent billion-dollar investment, Lyft may show that ride-hailing is an exception.
abstract: Lyft ride-sharing service wants a piece of market in booming industry, aiming to break what it outspokenly views as monopoly by Uber; experts caution against immediately defining market dominance as illegal, and point out that despite large number of big technology companies looming large in their respective markets, there have been relatively few big antitrust actions brought against tech giants.

byline.original: By DAVID GELLES and MIKE ISAAC

lead_paragraph: Effective monopolies are the rule in technology companies. But with a recent billion-dollar investment, Lyft may show that ride-hailing is an exception.

headline.main: Challenging Uber, Lyft Bets on a Road Wide Enough for Two
headline.print_headline: Betting That There’s Room for Two
